title.rendered: Signs You Need Window Repair In Vaughan

content.rendered:
Properly maintaining your windows is crucial to maintaining your home’s curb appeal and ensuring the cold winter weather stays outside. Windows can last anywhere from ten to 30 years, depending on the quality and the weather conditions where you live. It is common to need to repair a part or two over the lifespan of your windows to keep things in good working order. Apart from the obvious signs, how do you know it is time to have a professional come and inspect your windows? Luckily, there are things to look for when you inspect your windows. Here are three signs you may need professional window repair services in Vaughan.

Why Is Window Maintenance Important?

Window maintenance is a crucial part of maintaining your home’s aesthetic appeal and value. Taking proper care of your windows can help stop glass degradation and enhance the longevity of the frames and panes. Maintenance is particularly crucial for homes located near high-traffic roads or construction sites. Paint residue and road debris can be harmful to windows and should be cleaned regularly.

Sign #1- More Bugs Are Getting in Your Home

Most Vaughan homeowners experience bug problems at some point, especially during the warm summer months. However, you may have an issue with your windows if you suddenly notice more insects than usual inside your home. While the first line of defence against bugs is the window’s screen, more bug activity can signify rips.

The quality of your window frame can also impact how your screens function. Wooden structures can shrink, leaving a gap between the screen and the frame. It is likely time to repair your windows if you notice an increase in the number of bugs in your home.

Sign #2- Your Windows Get Foggy

It is normal for windows to get foggy occasionally, particularly during rainy weather conditions. However, windows that are constantly cloudy may need repairs. Windows in good working condition can keep the cold air from coming inside the home. Windows that have an issue may fail to keep air pockets from travelling between gaps in the frame. As a result, your windows may get foggy frequently.

You should contact a glass or window expert to inspect your windows if you suspect air is getting inside your home. If your windows are beyond repair, it may be an excellent option to upgrade to a more energy-efficient option. While these windows are more expensive initially, you’ll save money on your utility bills long-term.

Sign #3- Your Windows Are Hard to Open Or Close

Well-maintained windows should open and close quickly. The frames may have warped if it is harder to operate the windows. Warped windows are not only hard to open and shut, but they can also cause small cracks in the frame. These cracks can cause air to come inside, making your home drafty and driving up your utility bills. Warped windows are particularly troublesome for Vaughan homeowners due to the area’s wind, snow, and rain.

Call an expert to see if your warped windows are fixable. If your windows are beyond repair, it may be best to install a new set. Constantly repairing your windows for a temporary fix is much more expensive than installing new ones for a lasting solution.

Window Repair Services in Vaughan

Are you looking for a carpenter in Vaughan? Consider Handyman Connection. We offer a range of repair services to improve the look and functionality of your home. Our carpenters can help repair or replace your windows, depending on the nature of the damage. Contacting a trained carpenter is the best way to ensure the job is done correctly. Contact us today to schedule a window inspection.
